sub_subject.name: Writing & Composition
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Writing & Composition (Language Arts & Humanities)

objectives.objective_text: Identify beginning, middle, and end.
Identify spelling patterns while copying.
Identify sounds and write them down.
Identify errors in copying.
Identify why something happened (Because...).
Name the result (So...).
Identify signal words (since, therefore, consequently).
Identify how two things are the same.
Name how they are different.
Identify the basis of comparison.
Identify words for colors and sizes.
Name how something smells or feels.
Identify strong verbs and specific nouns.
Name the supplies needed.
Identify imperative verbs (Cut, Glue, Run).
Identify words spoken by characters.
Identify punctuation inside the quotes.
Name a memory.
Identify feelings in the story.
Name the problem.
Identify Rising Action and Falling Action.
Identify why we trust someone.
Name feelings like sad or happy.
Identify the appeal used in an argument.
Identify the counter-argument (what the other side says).
Identify the volta (turn) in a sonnet.
Identify Alliteration (sounds).
Identify the "Call to Action" (what you want them to do).
Name jobs I have done (chores).
Identify contact info.
Name the author.
Identify a Work Cited page.
Identify keywords for searching.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Identify the audience (who will read this?) before writing.
Recall that we learn by watching.
Observe capital letters and periods.
Recall a short sentence to write it.
Observe spelling while writing.
Recall checking back and forth.
Observe spacing between words.
Recall that actions have consequences.
Observe dominoes falling.
Recall sorting shapes.
Observe a Venn Diagram.
Recall that we paint pictures with words.
Observe details.
Recall how to make a sandwich.
Observe a recipe.
Recall that we take turns talking.
Observe quotation marks.
Recall a happy or sad day.
Observe using "I".
Recall the solution.
Observe a story mountain.
Recall using facts to win an argument.
Observe a commercial.
Recall "Because".
Observe that we need proof.
Recall a funny rhyming poem (Limerick).
Observe patterns.
Recall that poems paint pictures.
Observe line breaks.
Recall signing a name.
Observe subject lines.
List things I am good at.
Recall telling the truth.
Observe a neat list.
Recall that we don't steal words (Plagiarism).
Observe a list of books at the end.
Recall writing down the answer.
Write directions for a simple task.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Correct basic punctuation (commas in lists, apostrophes).

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Make a simple list of words to use.
Explain a Cover Letter (introduction).

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Compose a multi-paragraph essay with an introduction, body, and conclusion.
Copy a short Bible verse perfectly.
Trace letters carefully.
Summarize copying a poem to learn rhythm.
Explain why we copy good writers (to write like them).
Copy a paragraph from a living book.
Explain the "Commonplace Book" tradition.
Defend imitation as the path to innovation.
Write a letter that is spoken.
Summarize writing what you hear.
Explain holding a phrase in memory.
Write a dictation passage with correct punctuation.
Check work against the original.
Explain the cognitive challenge of transcription.
Defend the discipline of exactness.
Copy a word from the board.
Match shapes of letters.
Summarize looking at a text and writing it down.
Explain why exact copying is important (accuracy).
Transcribe a quote for a poster.
Explain the history of scribes copying Scripture.
Defend the preservation of texts through careful copying.
Summarize "If this, then that".
Explain the connection between an event and an outcome.
Write a paragraph about why plants grow (sun/water).
Explain the fallacy of post hoc ergo propter hoc (false cause).
Defend the logic of the argument.
Summarize similarities and differences.
Explain using "both" and "however".
Write about two favorite animals.
Explain analogy.
Defend the criteria used for comparison.
Summarize describing a favorite toy.
Explain using the five senses.
Change "The dog was nice" to "The dog wagged his tail".
Explain spatial organization (top to bottom, left to right).
Defend the aesthetic value of descriptive prose.
Tell steps in order (First, Next, Last).
Summarize instructions for a game.
Explain why order matters.
Explain anticipating user errors.
Defend the necessity of clarity in technical writing.
Use speech bubbles.
Summarize "He said" and "She said".
Explain that a new speaker gets a new paragraph.
Write a conversation between two friends.
Explain subtext in dialogue.
Defend the removal of unnecessary dialogue.
Tell a story about me.
Summarize a true event from my life.
Explain why it was important.
Focus on a small moment (seed story).
Explain the narrative arc in non-fiction.
Defend the subjective truth of memory.
Summarize the Plot.
Explain the Climax (most exciting part).
Write a story with a clear sequence.
Explain foreshadowing.
Defend the necessity of conflict.
Summarize trying to change someone's mind.
Explain Ethos (Character), Pathos (Emotion), Logos (Logic).
Write an ad for a toy.
Explain logical fallacies (intro).
Defend the primacy of Logos in academic writing.
State an opinion clearly.
Give one reason why.
Summarize the Thesis Statement (Main Idea).
Explain using examples to support the idea.
Write a paragraph with a claim and a reason.
Explain qualifiers (sometimes, usually).
Defend the argument against strong objections.
Write a poem with 3 lines (Haiku).
Count syllables (5-7-5).
Summarize AABBA rhyme scheme.
Explain the rules of a Sonnet (14 lines).
Write a Cinquain or Acrostic poem.
Explain Iambic Pentameter.
Defend the creativity required by constraints.
Write a poem without rhymes.
Use color words.
Summarize Free Verse (no rules for rhyme/rhythm).
Explain using the five senses in writing.
Use a metaphor to describe a feeling.
Explain enjambment (running lines together).
Defend the artistic choices in lineation.
Write a note to a friend.
Use a polite greeting (Dear...).
Summarize how to write a polite email to a teacher.
Explain being brief and clear.
Explain standard memo formatting.
Defend the importance of proofreading in business.
Summarize a Resume (list of skills and work).
Write a bio for a class project.
Explain formatting for readability.
Defend personal achievements with humility.
Say "My book says...".
Summarize citing a source.
Explain Quotation Marks.
Explain how to cite a website.
Defend the 8th Commandment (Stealing) applied to ideas.
Ask a question about an animal.
Look in a book for the answer.
Share what I learned.
Summarize picking a topic.
Explain gathering facts from different places.
Write a report using three sources.
Explain the thesis statement.
Defend a conclusion based on evidence.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Write sentences to tell a story.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Use 'best guess' spelling to keep writing moving.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Write from left to right and top to bottom.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Focus on getting thoughts on paper.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Write a complete paragraph with a topic sentence.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Use transition words (first, next, finally) to connect ideas.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Skip lines to make room for changes later.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Focus on content rather than perfect mechanics during the first draft.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Integrate quotes or evidence into the draft.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Maintain a consistent voice and tone.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Experiment with sentence variety during drafting.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Draft with specific rhetorical strategies in mind.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Produce a substantial draft ready for rigorous critique.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Circle misspelled words.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Check for capital letters at the start of sentences.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Check for periods at the end of sentences.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Make sure handwriting is readable.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Use a dictionary to fix spelling errors.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Fix run-on sentences and fragments.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Ensure subject-verb agreement.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Correct comma splices and misplaced modifiers.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Ensure consistent verb tense throughout.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Format citations correctly.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Perform a rigorous copy-edit for standard English conventions.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Defend stylistic choices against standard grammar rules when intentional.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Produce a polished manuscript free of mechanical errors.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Draw a picture to plan what to write.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Talk about ideas with a teacher before writing.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Choose a topic from personal experience.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Use a graphic organizer (like a web or map) to group ideas.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Brainstorm multiple ideas and select the best one.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Research background information to inform the plan.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Use free-writing techniques to overcome writer's block.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Develop a thesis statement that guides the entire structure.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Defend the organization of the argument prior to drafting.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Add a detail to a drawing or sentence.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Change a boring word to an interesting word.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Read the writing aloud to see if it makes sense.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Add a missing period or capital letter.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Add descriptive adjectives and strong verbs.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Move sentences to make the order better.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Remove repetitive words or sentences.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Check if the writing stays on topic.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Improve transitions between paragraphs.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Replace passive voice with active voice where appropriate.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Show, don't tell (replace summary with description).

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Reorganize entire sections to improve logical progression.
Interpret primary vs. secondary sources.
Analyze the sentence structure of a master writer.
Interpret the punctuation choices in a copywork passage.
Connect copywork to muscle memory.
Analyze errors to find spelling rules needed.
Interpret the flow of spoken language into written text.
Connect active listening to accuracy.
Analyze the formatting of the original text.
Interpret the use of indentation and paragraphs.
Connect transcription to data entry skills.
Analyze a chain of events in history.
Interpret immediate vs. long-term causes.
Connect multiple causes to a single effect.
Analyze the point-by-point vs. block method of organization.
Interpret the significance of the differences.
Connect comparison to decision making.
Analyze the effect of imagery.
Interpret the mood created by description.
Connect observation to writing.
Analyze the clarity of technical instructions.
Interpret diagrams accompanying text.
Connect precision to success.
Analyze character voice (how they sound different).
Interpret the use of dialogue tags vs. action beats.
Connect dialogue to character development.
Analyze the significance of the event (reflection).
Interpret the lesson learned.
Connect the personal story to a universal theme.
Analyze the Inciting Incident.
Interpret the Resolution (Denouement).
Connect pacing to tension.
Analyze the balance of the three modes.
Interpret how a speaker establishes credibility.
Connect emotional appeals to audience values.
Analyze the Toulmin Model (Claim, Data, Warrant).
Interpret the bridge between evidence and claim.
Connect rebuttal to strengthening the case.
Analyze the structure of a Villanelle.
Interpret the challenge of writing in form.
Connect form to content.
Analyze the use of white space on the page.
Interpret the rhythm of natural speech.
Connect imagery to emotion.
Compare a text message with an email.
Analyze tone (formal vs. informal).
Interpret the audience's needs.
Connect clarity to professionalism.
Analyze action verbs (Led, Created, Managed).
Interpret the job description keywords.
Connect experience to skills.
Analyze in-text citations (Smith 45).
Interpret the difference between MLA and APA style.
Connect attribution to intellectual honesty.
Analyze the reliability of a website.
Connect note-taking to outlining.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Analyze sentence structure for variety and flow.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the prompt to ensure the purpose is met.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the strength of the thesis statement.
Evaluate the stylistic devices in a passage.
Evaluate the precision of note-taking.
Evaluate the attention to detail.
Evaluate the strength of the causal link.
Evaluate which subject is superior based on criteria.
Evaluate the balance of detail (not too much, not too little).
Evaluate the usability of written instructions.
Evaluate the naturalism of speech.
Evaluate the balance of showing vs. telling in memoir.
Evaluate the satisfaction of the ending.
Evaluate the manipulation of pathos.
Evaluate the validity of the warrant.
Evaluate the adherence to meter and rhyme.
Evaluate the economy of language (every word counts).
Evaluate the etiquette of CC and BCC.
Evaluate the tailoring of a cover letter to a specific role.
Evaluate the credibility of sources.
Evaluate conflicting information.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the flow of logic while drafting.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the use of advanced punctuation (semicolons, colons).

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the effectiveness of different prewriting strategies for different tasks.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the rhetorical effectiveness of the piece.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Critique the clarity and precision of the language.
Create a simple bibliography (Author, Title).

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Create a simple outline with main points.
Synthesize the vocabulary and syntax of classics into own writing.
Construct a personal collection of wisdom quotes.
Construct a transcription of a lecture or speech.
Synthesize auditory processing with orthography.
Construct a handwritten manuscript of a favorite text.
Synthesize focus and patience in academic work.
Construct a causal analysis paper.
Synthesize historical analysis with expository writing.
Construct a comparative literature essay.
Synthesize synthesis of two distinct ideas.
Construct a vivid description of a setting.
Synthesize technical description with creative flair.
Construct a user manual or standard operating procedure.
Synthesize visual aids with procedural text.
Construct a scene driven by dialogue.
Synthesize distinct voices for multiple characters.
Construct a college application essay or personal statement.
Synthesize vulnerability with storytelling structure.
Construct a short story adhering to Freytag's Pyramid.
Synthesize structural innovation (non-linear) with coherence.
Construct a speech using all three appeals.
Synthesize rhetorical theory with persuasive practice.
Construct a formal argumentative essay.
Synthesize research into a cohesive argument.
Construct a Shakespearean Sonnet.
Synthesize traditional forms with modern themes.
Construct a portfolio of original poetry.
Synthesize voice and image.
Construct a professional proposal or report.
Synthesize concise writing with courtesy.
Construct a professional resume.
Synthesize personal brand in writing.
Construct a properly formatted research paper.
Synthesize research notes into a cited argument.
Construct a literature review.
Synthesize multiple sources into a cohesive paper.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Construct a cohesive argument that sustains a thesis throughout.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Construct a detailed alphanumeric outline.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize research notes into a coherent plan.

objectives.topic_name: The Writing Process and Writer’s Habits
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize feedback from peers or mentors to rewrite substantive portions.
